channel.title: CVE Feed for ManageEngine -- Applications Manager
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ManageEngine -- Applications Manager

item.title: CVE-2016-9490|2024-08-06T02:50:38.424Z -- manageengine -- applications%20manager
item.description: ManageEngine Applications Manager versions 12 and 13 before build 13200 suffer from a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability. Applications Manager is prone to a Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability in parameter LIMIT, in URL path /DiagAlertAction.do?REQTYPE=AJAX&LIMIT=1233. The URL is also available without authentication.

item.title: CVE-2016-9489|2024-08-06T02:50:38.431Z -- manageengine -- applications%20manager
item.description: In ManageEngine Applications Manager 12 and 13 before build 13200, an authenticated user is able to alter all of their own properties, including own group, i.e. changing their group to one with higher privileges like "ADMIN". A user is also able to change properties of another user, e.g. change another user's password.

item.title: CVE-2016-9488|2024-08-06T02:50:38.390Z -- manageengine -- applications%20manager
item.description: ManageEngine Applications Manager versions 12 and 13 before build 13200 suffer from remote SQL injection vulnerabilities. An unauthenticated attacker is able to access the URL /servlet/MenuHandlerServlet, which is vulnerable to SQL injection. The attacker could extract users' password hashes, which are MD5 hashes without salt, and, depending on the database type and its configuration, could also execute operating system commands using SQL queries.

item.title: CVE-2016-9498|2024-08-06T02:50:38.639Z -- manageengine -- applications%20manager
item.description: ManageEngine Applications Manager 12 and 13 before build 13200, allows unserialization of unsafe Java objects. The vulnerability can be exploited by remote user without authentication and it allows to execute remote code compromising the application as well as the operating system. As Application Manager's RMI registry is running with privileges of system administrator, by exploiting this vulnerability an attacker gains highest privileges on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2016-9491|2024-08-06T02:50:38.580Z -- manageengine -- applications%20manager
item.description: ManageEngine Applications Manager 12 and 13 before build 13690 allows an authenticated user, who is able to access /register.do page (most likely limited to administrator), to browse the filesystem and read the system files, including Applications Manager configuration, stored private keys, etc. By default Application Manager is running with administrative privileges, therefore it is possible to access every directory on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-5678|2024-08-01T06:54:25.601Z -- manageengine -- applications%20manager
item.description: Zohocorp ManageEngine Applications Manager versions 170900 and below are vulnerable to the authenticated admin-only SQL Injection in the Create Monitor feature.

item.title: CVE-2024-5678|2024-08-02T15:40:34.779Z -- manageengine -- applications%20manager
item.description: Zohocorp ManageEngine Applications Manager versions 170900 and below are vulnerable to the authenticated admin-only SQL Injection in the Create Monitor feature.
